channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How Mumbai hostage crisis ended with rescue of 17 children, death of kidnapper
The tragic story of 80-yr-old Aus woman who died after being left on remote island by cruise ship
Some bats glow green under UV light: But why can’t science explain it?
Netherlands set to get its youngest and first openly gay PM. Who is Rob Jetten?
Indian-origin man killed in Canada after he stopped stranger for urinating on his car: What we know
How RBI plans to make sending money home faster for Indians abroad
Russia’s Burevestnik missile test: How Europe is sleepwalking toward a nuclear crisis
item.description: Russia’s recent test of the Burevestnik missile marks a dangerous escalation in global nuclear competition, challenging arms control norms and exposing deepening rifts between Moscow, Washington, and Europe

item.title: Xi Jinping’s military purge: The dragon’s headless flight
item.description: Since taking power in 2012, Xi Jinping has removed a staggering 30 per cent of the generals he personally appointed

item.title: The oasis that dreamt big: UAE as West Asia’s fulcrum of transformation
item.description: The missing link that many ascribe to the Islamic world’s relative backwardness remains the knowledge deficit in technology and modern-day intellectualism—the UAE overcomes that brilliantly and acts as the fulcrum around which transformation of the Arab world will take place

item.title: CCP’s 4th Plenum: How China’s focus on self-reliance, tech sovereignty could impact world
item.description: Beijing may adopt more aggressive state-led investments and regulations in the strategic sectors

item.title: Kuala Lumpur Summit: A defining milestone for the Indo-Asean century
item.description: With Asean Vision 2045 and Viksit Bharat 2047 aligned, India and Asean have embarked on a shared journey of prosperity, resilience, and stability

item.title: Two democracies, one future: Why Washington must reset its trade ties with India
item.description: As China looms larger, a strong US-India partnership isn’t optional—it is essential. Policymakers in Washington should seize this moment and make a deal that is mutually beneficial while honouring Delhi’s aspirations
